This is a tutuorial and sandbox for me learning how to pass code back between R and Python using the R package "reticulate" and R marckdown.

Resources:
https://rstudio.github.io/reticulate/articles/r_markdown.html
https://www.infoworld.com/article/3340120/how-to-run-python-in-r.html

```{r setup, include=F}
library(reticulate)
Sys.which("python")
use_python("/usr/bin/python")
```

```{python}
import numpy as np
my_python_array = np.array([2,4,6,8])
for item in my_python_array:print(item)
quit()
```

```{r}
my_r_vector <- as.vector(py$my_python_array)
class(my_r_vector)
my_r_vector2 <- my_r_vector * 2
my_r_vector2
```

```{python}
my_python_array2 = r.my_r_vector2
print(my_python_array2)
quit()
```
